intro: Adnaria obscura, commonly known as the dark anemone, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its dark purple to black flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas and has a short, upright stem with broad, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in early spring and are known for their striking color contrast against the green foliage. Adnaria obscura is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and unique appearance.
